summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, revising the briefing schedule for motions in limine and setting the start time and location for jury selection (voir dire) on November 16, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, revising the briefing schedule and ordering the parties to appear for voir dire.

events.title: Conference on Motions in Limine
events.description: A conference was held regarding the defendant's first and seventh motions in limine.

events.title: Government Briefing Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to submit its supplemental briefing on the motions in limine.

events.title: Defense Briefing Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the defense to submit its supplemental briefing on the motions in limine.

events.title: Start of Voir Dire
events.description: Jury selection is scheduled to begin at 8:30 a.m. in Courtroom 518.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court order revises the briefing schedule for Ghislaine Maxwell's first and seventh motions in limine.
Jury selection (voir dire) for Maxwell's trial is scheduled to begin on November 16, 2021, at 8:30 a.m.
The proceedings are to be held in Courtroom 518 of the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York.
The order was issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan on November 10, 2021.
